title: oddnet
text: create sequence temporal networks based Erdos Renyi construction insert anomaly location 50. series, make edge probability increase 0.01 0.2. Let’s plot couple networks.
code: set.seed(1) networks <- list() p.or.m.seq <- seq(from = 0.01, to = 0.2, length.out = 100) p.or.m.seq[50] <- p.or.m.seq[50] + 0.2  # anomalous network  for(i in 1:100){   gr <- igraph::erdos.renyi.game(100, p.or.m = p.or.m.seq[i])   networks[[i]] <- igraph::as_adjacency_matrix(gr) }

title: oddnet
text: networks increased connectivity edge probability increases time. Let’s look anomalous network t = 50.
code: # Plotting network_1 <- networks[[1]] gr <- igraph::graph_from_adjacency_matrix(network_1) plot(gr,       layout = layout_with_fr,       vertex.size=3,       vertex.label=NA,      edge.arrow.size=0.2,       main = "Network 1") network_30 <- networks[[30]] gr <- igraph::graph_from_adjacency_matrix(network_30) plot(gr,       layout = layout_with_fr,       vertex.size=3,       vertex.label=NA,      edge.arrow.size=0.2,       main = "Network 30") network_80 <- networks[[80]] gr <- igraph::graph_from_adjacency_matrix(network_80) plot(gr,       layout = layout_with_fr,       vertex.size=3,       vertex.label=NA,      edge.arrow.size=0.2,       main = "Network 80") # Plotting network_a <- networks[[50]] gr <- igraph::graph_from_adjacency_matrix(network_a) plot(gr,       layout = layout_with_fr,       vertex.size=3,       vertex.label=NA,      edge.arrow.size=0.2,       main = "Network 50 - Anomaly")

title: oddnet
text: networks t = 50 t = 80 look alike. Let’s explore degree distributions.   see clear difference degree distributions two networks. Let’s look average degree network sequence.   clearly see anomaly 50. Oddnet feature-based method. computing many features finds anomalies using time series methods. Let’s find anomalous networks using oddnet.
code: network_80 <- networks[[80]] gr <- igraph::graph_from_adjacency_matrix(network_80) hist(degree(gr)) network_a <- networks[[50]] gr <- igraph::graph_from_adjacency_matrix(network_a) hist(degree(gr)) avg_deg <- rep(0, 100) max_deg <- rep(0, 100) for(i in 1:100){   network <- networks[[i]]   gr <- igraph::graph_from_adjacency_matrix(network)   avg_deg[i] <- mean(degree(gr))   max_deg[i] <- max(degree(gr)) } plot(avg_deg, type = "l") plot(max_deg, type = "l")

title: oddnet
text: see correct anomaly identified low conditional probability.
code: anomalous_networks(networks) #> Warning in sqrt(diag(best$var.coef)): NaNs produced  #> Warning in sqrt(diag(best$var.coef)): NaNs produced #> Leave-out-out KDE outliers using lookout algorithm #>  #> Call: lookout::lookout(X = dfpca[, 1:dd], alpha = alpha) #>  #>   Outliers Probability #> 1       50           0

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sevvandi Kandanaarachchi. Author, maintainer. Rob Hyndman. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kandanaarachchi S, Hyndman R (2023). oddnet: Anomaly Detection Temporal Networks. R package version 0.1.0, https://sevvandi.github.io/oddnet/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {oddnet: Anomaly Detection in Temporal Networks},   author = {Sevvandi Kandanaarachchi and Rob Hyndman},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://sevvandi.github.io/oddnet/}, }

title: Anomaly Detection in Temporal Networks
text: goal oddnet identify anomalous networks series temporal networks.

title: Anomaly Detection in Temporal Networks
text: can install development version oddnet GitHub :

title: Anomaly Detection in Temporal Networks
text: example generate series networks add anomalous network location 50.
code: library(oddnet) library(igraph) #>  #> Attaching package: 'igraph' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     decompose, spectrum #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     union set.seed(1) networks <- list() p.or.m.seq <- rep(0.05, 100) p.or.m.seq[50] <- 0.2  # outlying network at 50 for(i in 1:100){  gr <- igraph::erdos.renyi.game(100, p.or.m = p.or.m.seq[i])  networks[[i]] <- igraph::as_adjacency_matrix(gr) } anom <- anomalous_networks(networks) anom #> Leave-out-out KDE outliers using lookout algorithm #>  #> Call: lookout::lookout(X = dfpca[, 1:dd], alpha = alpha) #>  #>   Outliers Probability #> 1       50           0

what: Identifies anomalous networks from a series of temporal networks. — anomalous_networks
title: Identifies anomalous networks from a series of temporal networks. — anomalous_networks
text: function identifies anomalous networks series temporal networks. uses graph theoretic features transform networks feature space. function parameters feature computation, scaling, robust PCA anomaly detection procedures.   ADD DESCRIPTION.

title: Identifies anomalous networks from a series of temporal networks. — anomalous_networks
code: anomalous_networks(   networks,   alpha = 0.05,   dd = 2,   trim = 0.005,   na_action = NULL,   vert_attr = FALSE,   attr_name = NULL,   attr_mat = NULL,   fast = FALSE )

title: Identifies anomalous networks from a series of temporal networks. — anomalous_networks
text: networks input series temporal networks given list network denoted adjacency matrix. alpha anomaly detection parameter. level significance anomaly detection algorithm lookout. Default 0.05. dd robust PCA parameter. number reduced dimensions robust PCA. Default 2. trim scaling parameter. percentage used compute trimmed mean trimmed standard deviation. Default 0.5 percent. na_action action NA valued features. vert_attr feature computation parameter. TRUE network nodes/vertices attributes. attr_name feature computation parameter. name network vertex attribute. single attribute can specified. attr_mat feature computation parameter. network nodes/vertices attributes, list attribute matrices network can given using feature. fast set TRUE avoid computing time consuming features.

title: Identifies anomalous networks from a series of temporal networks. — anomalous_networks
text: Object imported lookout.

title: Identifies anomalous networks from a series of temporal networks. — anomalous_networks
code: # We generate a series of networks and add an anomaly at 50th network. set.seed(1) networks <- list() p.or.m.seq <- rep(0.1, 50) p.or.m.seq[20] <- 0.3  # anomalous network at 20 for(i in 1:50){   gr <- igraph::erdos.renyi.game(50, p.or.m = p.or.m.seq[i])   networks[[i]] <- igraph::as_adjacency_matrix(gr) } anomalous_networks(networks, fast = TRUE) #> Leave-out-out KDE outliers using lookout algorithm #>  #> Call: lookout::lookout(X = dfpca[, 1:dd], alpha = alpha) #>  #>   Outliers Probability #> 1       20           0 #>

what: Computes features for each network. — compute_features
title: Computes features for each network. — compute_features
text: function computes features network using graph theoretic constructs.

title: Computes features for each network. — compute_features
code: compute_features(gr, attributes = FALSE, attr_name = NULL, fast = FALSE)

title: Computes features for each network. — compute_features
text: gr network graph igraph object. attributes network nodes/vertices attributes, attributes = TRUE. attr_name name node/vertex attribute. single attribute can specified. fast set TRUE avoid computing time consuming features.

title: Computes features for each network. — compute_features
text: network features object containing 20 graph-theoretic features.

title: Computes features for each network. — compute_features
code: set.seed(1) gr <- igraph::erdos.renyi.game(100, 0.05) compute_features(gr) #> $num_nodes #> [1] 100 #>  #> $triangles_99 #> 99%  #>   4  #>  #> $degree_99 #> 99%  #>  10  #>  #> $edges #> [1] 243 #>  #> $density #> [1] 0.04909091 #>  #> $clustering_coef #> [1] 0.04991243 #>  #> $assortativity #> [1] 0.01358161 #>  #> $mean_distance #> [1] 3.015359 #>  #> $diameter #> [1] 6 #>  #> $isolates #> [1] 0.02 #>  #> $connectivity #> [1] 0 #>  #> $efficiency #> [1] 0.361064 #>  #> $num_clusters #> [1] 3 #>  #> $cluster_size_99 #>   99%  #> 96.06  #>  #> $close_overpoint8 #> [1] 0 #>  #> $betweenness_99 #>      99%  #> 272.1782  #>  #> $pagerank_99 #>       99%  #> 0.0181668  #>  #> $cores_99 #> 99%  #>   4  #>  #> $hubs_value #> [1] 34.00637 #>  #> $authority_value #> [1] 34.00637 #>  #> $call #> compute_features(gr = gr) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "networkfeatures"

text: object class lad. LAD window based method. considers short long windows.  lad object anomalous scores taking account short long windows along identified anomalies short long windows.

what: oddnet: Anomaly Detection in Temporal Networks — oddnet-package
title: oddnet: Anomaly Detection in Temporal Networks — oddnet-package
text: Anomaly detection dynamic, temporal networks. package 'oddnet' uses feature-based method identify anomalies. First, computes many features network. models features using time series methods. Using time series residuals detects anomalies. way, temporal dependencies accounted identifying anomalies (Kandanaarachchi, Hyndman 2022) arXiv:2210.07407.

title: oddnet: Anomaly Detection in Temporal Networks — oddnet-package
text: Maintainer: Sevvandi Kandanaarachchi sevvandik@gmail.com (ORCID) Authors: Rob Hyndman rob.hyndman@monash.edu (ORCID)
